info.title: MilkBot lactation API
info.description:
This service uses the MilkBot® fitting engine to fit the MilkBot® model to lactation data supplied as (DIM, milk weight) data points. The returned parameter set can be substituted into the MilkBot® equation

((1 - E^((offset - t)/ramp)/2)*scale)/E^(decay X t)

to generate predicted milk production at any time in the lactation, where t is time since calving (in days, DIM=0 at calving) and E is Euler's number.

Simple formulas described at the support URL can calculate persistence, M305, or cumulative milk between dates. The fitting process uses Bayesian priors describing expected means and variance of parameter values as well as expected mean and variance in fitting error. If priors are provided, they will be used. Otherwise default values based on breed and parity will be used

get.description: Fit a single lactation from the supplied (DIM, milk weight) data pairs using a default set of Bayesian priors based on breed and parity

schema.description: A single lactation of any length.

lacKey.description: an identifier to key this lactation. **_lacKey_** values must be unique within a LactationList.

milk.description: quantity of milk produced in one day, or a fraction of a day if **_dayFraction_** is supplied. Milk is measured in units specified by **_milkUnit_**, defaulting to kg

name.description: abbreviated name of measurement unit lb=pounds, kg=kilograms, l=liters, g=grams

milkUnit.description: Unit of measurement used for scale and milk weights, defaulting to kg.

dayFraction.description: fraction of one day's production that **_milk_** represents, defaulting to 1.0

name.description: abbreviated name of measurement unit lb=pounds, kg=kilograms, l=liters, g=grams

unit.description: Unit of measurement used for scale and milk weights, defaulting to kg.

schema.description: Parameter set for the MilkBot model

scale.description: Overall scale of milk production in units specified by milkUnit. The MilkBot® model can be converted to another unit of measurement for milk simply by multiplying the scale parameter by an appropriate conversion factor

ramp.description: Length of ramp-up period at start of lactation, in **days**.

offset.description: Offset between calving and theoretical start of lactation in **days**.

decay.description: first order decay constant in inverse-days that controls the decline in milk production.

name.description: abbreviated name of measurement unit lb=pounds, kg=kilograms, l=liters, g=grams

milkUnit.description: Unit of measurement used for scale and milk weights, defaulting to kg.

errorType.description: a URI identifier that categorizes the error

title.description: A brief, human-readable message about the error

detail.description: a human-readable description of the specific error
detail.example: Authentication failed due to incorrect username or password.

instance.description: a URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the error

errorType.description: a URI identifier that categorizes the error

title.description: A brief, human-readable message about the error

detail.description: a human-readable description of the specific error
detail.example: Authentication failed due to incorrect username or password.

instance.description: a URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the error

post.description: Fit a group of lactations returning fitted parameter values. If '**_priors_**' are supplied they will be used. Otherwise fitting will be done from defaults.

name.description: name for this group of lactations, such as herd name or group

items.description: A single lactation of any length.

lacKey.description: an identifier to key this lactation. **_lacKey_** values must be unique within a LactationList.

milk.description: quantity of milk produced in one day, or a fraction of a day if **_dayFraction_** is supplied. Milk is measured in units specified by **_milkUnit_**, defaulting to kg

name.description: abbreviated name of measurement unit lb=pounds, kg=kilograms, l=liters, g=grams

milkUnit.description: Unit of measurement used for scale and milk weights, defaulting to kg.

dayFraction.description: fraction of one day's production that **_milk_** represents, defaulting to 1.0

name.description: abbreviated name of measurement unit lb=pounds, kg=kilograms, l=liters, g=grams

unit.description: Unit of measurement used for scale and milk weights, defaulting to kg.

name.description: abbreviated name of measurement unit lb=pounds, kg=kilograms, l=liters, g=grams

milkUnit.description: Unit of measurement used for scale and milk weights, defaulting to kg.

priors.description: Optional prior expectations to be used during fitting. This can be an array of any size. For each lactation, any priors supplied will be checked in the order they are supplied and the first one used for which the discriminator fits data for the lactation. If none match, or none are supplied, then system defaults will be used.

items.description: Optional Bayesian prior expectations for use by fitting engine. If not provided, defaults based on breed and parity will be used. **_means_** are the expected mean parameter values for the population and **_sd_** are expected standard deviation of parameter values for the population **_seMilk_** is expected standard error of milk measurements excluding the effects of a normal lactation curve

offset.description: Offset between calving and theoretical start of lactation in **days**.

decay.description: first order decay constant in inverse-days that controls the decline in milk production.
